importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game and the pivotal outcome in the ALCS that forces a Game 7, marking a significant moment in the postseason trajectory.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame shows the progression of the ALCS, culminating in the Game 7 decision after a series of key performances and errors.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run in the postseason, extending the Blue Jays' lead to 5-0 and pushing the series to Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners' season-high three errors — two in the second inning — directly contributed to early Toronto runs and the momentum shift.
Randy Arozarena and Ernie Clement's early hits and errors allowed the Blue Jays to build a 4-0 lead, with a pivotal wild pitch from Matt Brash in the seventh allowing Guerrero to score.
The Blue Jays' Game 7 appearance is their first since 1985, marking a historic moment in franchise history.
The Mariners will play their first Game 7 in history, adding to the significance of the matchup.
The winner of the ALCS faces the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
Randy Arozarena's resilience and composure, including throwing a season-high 31 splitters with 7 strikeouts, played a crucial role in the Mariners’ defense.
The Blue Jays' dominance in the series is highlighted by Guerrero Jr.'s six-homer playoff performance and key defensive and pitching moments.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth home run in the postseason, a key factor in the Blue Jays' victory and the series progression to Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They dominated the Mariners 6-2 in Game 6, forcing a decisive Game 7 and marking a significant moment in their franchise history.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They lost to the Blue Jays in a critical Game 6, resulting in their first-ever Game 7 appearance in history.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series outcome determines the AL representative for the World Series, with the Blue Jays forcing a Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are the NL champion and the eventual opponent in the World Series after the ALCS winner is determined.

namedEntities.name: Randy Arozarena
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored a run in the sixth inning off a single and was involved in a key defensive play that ended Trey Yesavage’s inning early.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that resulted in a fielding error, enabling a run to score and helping the Blue Jays build an early lead.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodríguez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He made a fielding error on a single from Daulton Varsho, allowing a baserunner to advance and contributing to the early scoring.

namedEntities.name: Eugenio Suárez
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He lost a ball during a transfer throw, resulting in a fielding error that allowed a run to score.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He reached base on a play that resulted in a fielding error by Julio Rodríguez, allowing a run to score.

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit an RBI single and later a two-run homer, contributing to the Blue Jays’ early lead.

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched effectively, throwing a season-high 31 splitters with 7 strikeouts and only 6 hits, helping the Mariners hold the game together.

namedEntities.name: Matt Brash
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He committed a wild pitch in the seventh inning that allowed Vladimir Guerrero Jr. to score, extending the lead to 6-2.

namedEntities.name: Louis Varland
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was the reliever who faced Eugenio Suárez, who hit a single that scored a run and extended the Mariners’ scoring.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits his sixth home run of the 2025 postseason, leading the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-2 victory over the Seattle Mariners and forcing a decisive Game 7 in the American League Championship Series. The Mariners’ season-high three errors—two in the second inning—contributed to early runs, while key performances by players like Randy Arozarena, Ernie Clement, and Julio Rodríguez impacted the game’s flow. The Blue Jays’ first Game 7 since 1985 and the Mariners’ first in history underscore the significance of the matchup. The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
